posts.cooked: I’m on android 14 with a s24. Signal crashed after trying to restore a backup. i really don’t know what to do? Is there a fix or a solution?
I think without a debug log it is hard to tell what went wrong. Can you send a log file?
No log because signal crash if i try to open it.
Have you tried opening Signal in airplane mode? Depending on the kind of error, this might work.
i tried but no success
No one to help? I still at the same point.

Which version of Signal are you using on your new device?
How old is your backup (days/ years?)
Have you tried reinstalling Signal? (after securing your backup file!)

If you’re comfortable with sharing some personal information (I think app usage time etc is included) somebody might be able to help you if you can provide a system log

Signal 7.28.4
signal-2023-08-01-19-00-01 (size 1,25Go)
Yes many times. I changed phone to samsung s24 with a new phone number.
I can’t access to log because app crash
Using signal for 5 or 6 years and never had a problem to restore a back up on a new phone.

I tried to install signal, made a backup from the start. then copy my back up in the folder and i tried to restore but no success.

ok to share some informations

virgo4:

I changed phone to samsung s24 with a new phone number

Disclaimer: I’m a casual iOS user, just trying to help

Did you change your phone number in Signal already (as described here) or are you trying to restore a backup created with your old number after registering with your new number (not sure if this is supported)

When exactly does the app crash? Directly when you installed and open it? Or does it crash during import of old backup? If I recall correctly when app started there is some “magic” tapping to enable logging… have to check

Edit: here tapping 8 times during registration is mentioned:

App crashes for a friend - Android 9, Samsung A40 Android Support
If you’re in the registration flow then tap 8 times quickly on the welcome screen or a header in one of the next screens, but I think you’ve already completed registration. Maybe this helps when you try to re-register first again. Alternatively you can send system bug logs but don’t post them anywhere publicly because these contain more info, also about other apps. But if you’re comfortable to send it to Signal support you have some instructions here: Capture and read bug reports  |  Android…

link_counts.title: App crashes for a friend - Android 9, Samsung A40

posts.cooked:
Stephan:

If I recall correctly when app started there is some “magic” tapping to enable logging

Yep, you are right: Source

Steps to share a debug log from Signal’s registration or PIN flow:

Select Contact Support from the screen or follow steps below.

  1. Tap 8x on the header of any screen.
  2. Tap and hold to copy the URL.
  1. share the URL in this thread (there is no personal data included)
I’m trying to restore a back created with my old number after registering with my new number. If not supported, what the utility to have a pass key of 12 words???
it crash during import of old backup and then impossible to open the app. i don’t know if the 8 times tapping trick can work in my case.

Yes…
Give it a try:
Reinstall app
Start it
Start registration/import
Do the tapping before it crashes…

Only other thing I found is using tool
“adb logcat” to get logs from android with external computer - but never tried that… search for it here in forum

I don’t know if this is supported to be honest. Do you still have access to the old number. If so I would recommend to register again with the old number → restore the backup → change your phone number
i wish i could but, no more access.

i tried during the backup restore but it crash before i can access to log.
The link below is the log when i just install the app.
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.28.4/75d10e26c8db698be74558035738dcdb67c4521d4308f6a5929f1e6b713044f3
adb logcat org.thoughtcrime.securesms > output.txt don’t work with apple mac terminal

https://github.com/bepaald/signalbackup-tools?tab=readme-ov-file#macos

i get this link, is there someone who can guide me to install the signalbackup-tools on mac? It’s a Tool to work with backup files generated by the Signal Android application.

posts.cooked: While I can’t help with the MacOS installation, that program should be able to merge the two backups.
